events.originalText: NASA announced the discovery of Kepler-186f, the first exoplanet with a radius similar to Earth's discovered in the habitable zone of another star.
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: NASA Discovers Earth-like Exoplanet Kepler-186f in Habitable Zone

events.originalText: Having supposedly been at war for 335 years without a single shot having been fired and no casualties incurred, the Netherlands and the Isles of Scilly declared peace.
events.subtitle: Three Hundred and Thirty Five Years' War
events.headline: Netherlands and Isles of Scilly Declare Peace After 335 Years of War

events.originalText: Metropolitan Police officer Yvonne Fletcher was shot and killed while on duty during a protest outside the Libyan embassy in London's St James's Square, resulting in an 11-day police siege of the building and a breakdown of diplomatic relations between the two nations.
events.subtitle: Metropolitan Police
events.headline: Metropolitan Police Officer Yvonne Fletcher Killed Outside Libyan Embassy

events.originalText: The Khmer Rouge captured Phnom Penh, the capital of the Khmer Republic, ending the Cambodian Civil War and establishing the socialist state of Democratic Kampuchea.
events.subtitle: Khmer Rouge
events.headline: Khmer Rouge Captures Phnom Penh, Ending Cambodian Civil War

events.originalText: George Lucas began writing a 13-page film treatment entitled The Star Wars.
events.subtitle: George Lucas
events.headline: George Lucas Begins Writing 'The Star Wars' Treatment

events.originalText: Ustaše-affiliated Croatian separatists attacked the Yugoslav embassy in Stockholm, fatally shooting the ambassador, Vladimir Rolović.
events.subtitle: Ustaše
events.headline: Yugoslav Ambassador Vladimir Rolović Shot Dead in Stockholm Embassy Attack

events.originalText: Sirhan Sirhan was convicted of the assassination of United States Senator Robert F. Kennedy.
events.subtitle: Sirhan Sirhan
events.headline: Sirhan Sirhan Convicted of Robert F. Kennedy Assassination

events.originalText: The Peak District was designated the first national park in the United Kingdom.
events.subtitle: Peak District
events.headline: Peak District Designated First National Park in UK

events.originalText: Minas Geraes (pictured), the first of three Brazilian dreadnought battleships, was laid down, sparking a vastly expensive South American naval arms race with Argentina and Chile.
events.subtitle: Brazilian battleship Minas Geraes
events.headline: Brazil Lays Down First Dreadnought Battleship Minas Geraes

events.originalText: Napoleonic Wars: After a three-day chase, a British squadron under Alexander Cochrane captured the French ship-of-the-line D'Hautpoul off Puerto Rico.
events.subtitle: Napoleonic Wars
events.headline: British Squadron Captures French Ship D'Hautpoul in Napoleonic Wars

events.originalText: French Revolutionary Wars: British forces commanded by Lieutenant-General Ralph Abercromby invaded the Spanish colonial port of San Juan, Puerto Rico.
events.subtitle: French Revolutionary Wars
events.headline: British Forces Invade San Juan, Puerto Rico in French Revolutionary Wars

events.originalText: The Mechanical Turk, a fraudulent chess-playing "machine" by Wolfgang von Kempelen that was secretly controlled by a hidden human, began a tour of Europe.
events.subtitle: Mechanical Turk
events.headline: Fraudulent Chess-Playing 'Machine' Mechanical Turk Begins European Tour

events.originalText: Lithuanian Crusade: After a month-long siege, forces of the Teutonic Order captured and destroyed Kaunas Castle (reconstruction pictured), which was defended by troops of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania.
events.subtitle: Lithuanian Crusade
events.headline: Teutonic Order Captures and Destroys Kaunas Castle After Siege

events.originalText: Canute IV became King of Denmark upon the death of his brother Harald III.
events.subtitle: Canute IV of Denmark
events.headline: Canute IV Becomes King of Denmark After Brother's Death
